column1: #Text=The studied polycrystalline PrFe1-xCoxAsO (x = 0.0, 0.02, 0.05, 0.07, 0.10, 0.15, 0.20, 0.25, 0.30, 0.50, 0.75 and 1.0) samples are synthesized through single step solid-state reaction route via vacuum encapsulation technique.

#Text=High purity (~99.9%) powders of Pr, As, Fe2O3, Fe, and Co3O4 in their stoichiometric ratios are weighed, mixed and ground thoroughly using mortar and pestle in presence of high purity Ar atmosphere in glove box.
#Text=The Humidity and Oxygen content in the glove box are maintained at less than 1 ppm.
#Text=The mixed powders are palletized and vacuum-sealed (10-4 Torr) in a quartz tube.
#Text=These sealed samples are placed in box furnace under the heat treatment, 550ºC for 12 h, 850ºC for 12 h and then at 1150ºC for 33 h in continuum with slow heating rate.
#Text=Finally furnace is finally cooled down to room temperature.
#Text=The crystal structure and phase are analyzed by the powder X-ray diffraction patterns at room temperature using Rigaku Xray diffractometer with CuKα radiation.
#Text=The resistivity measurements under magnetic field are carried out by a conventional four-probe method using Quantum Design Physical Property Measurement System (PPMS) with fields up to 14 T.
